info.guardianproject.cacheword

Class CacheWordHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • info.guardianproject.cacheword.CacheWordHandler
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    CacheWordActivityHandler

    public class CacheWordHandler
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is designed to accompany any Activity that is interested in the secrets cached by CacheWord. The context provided in the constructor must implement the ICacheWordSubscriber interface. This is so the Activity can be alerted to the state change events.

      • CacheWordHandler

        public CacheWordHandler(Context context,
                        ICacheWordSubscriber subscriber)
        Initializes the CacheWordHandler with distinct Context and ICacheWordSubscriber objects. Uses default CacheWordSettings

      • CacheWordHandler

        public CacheWordHandler(Context context,
                        CacheWordSettings settings)
        Initializes the CacheWordHandler. Use this form when your Context (e.g, the Activity) also implements the ICacheWordSubscriber interface. Context MUST impement ICacheWordSubscriber, else IllegalArgumentException will be thrown at runtime
        Parameters:
        context - must implement the ICacheWordSubscriber interface
        settings - the settings for CacheWord

      • CacheWordHandler

        public CacheWordHandler(Context context,
                        ICacheWordSubscriber subscriber,
                        CacheWordSettings settings)
        Initializes the CacheWordHandler with distinct Context and ICacheWordSubscriber objects
        Parameters:
        context - your application's or activity's context
        subscriber - the object to notify of CW events
        settings - the settings for CacheWord

    • Method Detail

      • connectToService

        public void connectToService()
        Connect to the CacheWord service, starting it if necessary. Once connected, the attached Context will begin receiving CacheWord events.

      • detach

        public void detach()
        Detach but don't disconnect from the CacheWord service. CacheWord events will continue to be received, but this client will not be considered when performing automatic timeouts.

      • reattach

        public void reattach()
        Reattach to the CacheWord service.

      • disconnect

        public void disconnect()
        Disconnect from the CacheWord service. No further CacheWord events will be received.

      • getCachedSecrets

        public ICachedSecrets getCachedSecrets()
        Fetch the secrets from CacheWord
        Returns:
        the secrets or null on failure

      • getEncryptionKey

        public byte[] getEncryptionKey()

      • setCachedSecrets

        public void setCachedSecrets(ICachedSecrets secrets)
        Write the secrets into CacheWord, initializing the cache if necessary.
        Parameters:
        secrets -

      • setPassphrase

        public void setPassphrase(char[] passphrase)
                   throws java.security.GeneralSecurityException
        Use the basic PassphraseSecrets implementation to derive encryption keys securely. Initializes cacheword if necessary.
        Parameters:
        passphrase -
        Throws:
        java.security.GeneralSecurityException - on invalid password

      • changePassphrase

        public PassphraseSecrets changePassphrase(PassphraseSecrets current_secrets,
                                          char[] new_passphrase)
                                   throws java.io.IOException
        Changes the passphrase used to encrypt the derived encryption keys. Since the derived encryption key stays the same, this can safely be called even when the secrets are in use. Only works if you're using the PassphraseSecrets implementation. (i.e., Are you using setPassphrase() or setCachedSecrets()?)
        Parameters:
        current_secrets - the current secrets you're using
        new_passphrase - the new passphrase to encrypt the old secrets with
        Returns:
        null on error or current_secrets on success
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • manuallyLock

        public void manuallyLock()
        Clear the secrets from memory. This is only a request to CacheWord. The cache should not be considered wiped and locked until the onLockEvent is received.

      • isLocked

        public boolean isLocked()
        Returns:
        true if the cache is locked or uninitialized, false otherwise

      • setTimeoutSeconds
